text: Probably a stupid newbie question (sorry!), but how can I manage the `cannot define function a; it already has a value`  when working in a Notebook? How can I re-initialize the a?

elements.text: Probably a stupid newbie question (sorry!), but how can I manage the
cannot define function a; it already has a value
when working in a Notebook? How can I re-initialize the a?

text: You can change the value of non-const variables, but not use the same identifier for a function. Use different names, and restart the kernel if you want to start from a clean state

elements.text: You can change the value of non-const variables, but not use the same identifier for a function. Use different names, and restart the kernel if you want to start from a clean state
